test_cases.notes: POST /api/projects and GET /api/projects work correctly with progress calculation.

test_cases.description: Add task with assignee and deadline
test_cases.notes: POST /api/projects/{id}/tasks accepts assignee_id and deadline; frontend populates user names.
Drag-and-drop updates status via PUT /api/tasks/{id} with validation; UI reflects changes.

test_cases.description: Filter tasks by assignee and highlight overdue
test_cases.notes: GET /api/tasks?assignee_id= filters correctly; frontend shows usernames and overdue highlighting.
Kanban columns display tasks with drag-and-drop; polling refreshes data every 10 seconds.

summary: All user stories are implemented successfully with improved validation, user management, and UI feedback.
recommendations: Consider adding WebSocket for real-time updates instead of polling.
Add more comprehensive error handling for network failures.
Implement task editing beyond status updates (e.g., title, description).
